Certainly! Below is an HTML file that creates a simple A-Frame VR scene with animated penguins that move randomly every second. You can copy and paste the entire code block into a single HTML file and open it in a web browser to view the scene.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Animated Penguins VR</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body { margin: 0; }
        a-scene { height: 100vh; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

        <!-- Ground -->
        <a-plane position="0 0 -5" rotation="-90 0 0" width="20" height="20" color="#7CFC00"></a-plane>

        <!-- Penguins -->
        <a-entity id="penguin1" position="-2 0 -5" geometry="primitive: box; width: 0.5; height: 1; depth: 0.5" material="color: black"></a-entity>
        <a-entity id="penguin2" position="0 0 -5" geometry="primitive: box; width: 0.5; height: 1; depth: 0.5" material="color: black"></a-entity>
        <a-entity id="penguin3" position="2 0 -5" geometry="primitive: box; width: 0.5; height: 1; depth: 0.5" material="color: black"></a-entity>

        <!-- Camera -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>

    <script>
        // Function to move penguins randomly
        function movePenguin(penguin) {
            const randomX = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 4; // Random X position between -2 and 2
            const randomZ = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 4; // Random Z position between -2 and 2
            penguin.setAttribute('position', { x: randomX, y: 0, z: randomZ });
        }

        // Get penguin entities
        const penguins = [
            document.getElementById('penguin1'),
            document.getElementById('penguin2'),
            document.getElementById('penguin3')
        ];

        // Move each penguin every second
        setInterval(() => {
            penguins.forEach(penguin => movePenguin(penguin));
        }, 1000);
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Instructions:
1. Copy the code above.
2. Paste it into a new file and save it with a `.html` extension (e.g., `animated_penguins_vr.html`).
3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR (like Chrome or Firefox).
4. Watch the penguins move randomly every second!

Enjoy your animated penguin scene!
